main event: On January 29, 1952, a B-29 aircraft observed a large, bright, blue-hued object traveling at a high rate of speed before climbing and fading out over Cedar Keys, Florida.
interesting points: The observed object was estimated to be about the size of a dinner plate at arm's length and had a duration of sighting of approximately 3 seconds.
The object's behavior was described as a large bluish-green fireball, and the crew reported seeing it explode and disintegrate, leaving behind a glowing tail.
Multiple crew members with extensive flying experience, including a bombardier and a flight engineer, were involved in the observation and provided their accounts of the incident.

The described observation is noted as typical of the 'green fireball' class of unidentified objects that the Air Force Cambridge Research Laboratory had been investigating for the past two years with no conclusions reached.
The report was unclassified and marked as part of the ongoing data collection by the Air Technical Intelligence Center (ATIC) for future reference.
witnesses: B-29 aircraft crew members with significant flying experience
